Detailed Description

Representation of a chemical element within a compound.

Besides of the properties a ChemicalElementInterface element consists of, this one has an additional property:

  • A coefficient value to specify the amount of this element in the overall compound, i.e. formula (as in H2).
    See also:
    setCoef, coef

std::string CompoundElementInterface::doToMarkup ( void   )  const [protected, virtual]

String representation of this CompoundElement with markup text formatting.

This includes <sup> for the nucleon number and <sub> for the coefficient value.

Returns:
The formatted string.

std::string CompoundElementInterface::doToString ( void   )  const [protected, virtual]

String representation of this element.

Builds a string with the symbol preceded by the nucleon number (if it is an isotope) and followed by the compound coefficient.

Reimplemented from cfp::ChemicalElementInterface.
